page.title: 01Newtondale and its villages
page.content: This area is divided by part of Newtondale through which passes Pickering Beck and also the north Yorkshire Moors railway. The dale is well forested with deciduous trees. The South West area is well armed with both arable and grassland and there are dairy and pig farms. The North west area is mostly wooded. The South East is arable type farming while the north east is poorer type soil mainly pasture for cattle and sheep and it merges on to the Moor. In the west is Newton-Upon-Rawcliffe, a farming community wth a public house and post office/general shop, a church and a chapel. There are also pond which attract geese. In the east is the village of Levisham, with public house and a post office/shop and a church. Also a farming community, with some houses used as holiday cottages
